column4: when I run fdisk -l it says "Disk /dev/sda doesn't contain a valid partiton table"
nothing else? do you run feisty?
i see, so /different/ computers aren't able to read from the USB disk in question... Did you drop it? :-)
just to sort that out: you said *sudo* fdisk -l , no?
so read your dmesg first, then cat /proc/partitions to see if the kernel has any idea of what is on the USB disk. What did you do with it?
hmmm, so testdisk should be able to help you
